values:
wow I can't believe I only gained .5 lbs after 2 weeks visiting mom and dad in TX. That is truly amazing for all the crap I ate. I keep trying to think back to what I did right, and can't figure it out!

It's so hard to get to work. It's cold and miserable here and TX was warm and happy. I miss mom and dad so much, and I want so bad to move down there and work with mom in real estate. Find a cute house with a big yard where we can do our halloween display. But Sean won't even consider it. So I cry everyday... he suggest we find a nicer climate in a city we can both like. North Carolina seems promising... but still San Antonio would be so nice.
I was thinking today, how if I didn't know I have an illness, I wouldn't think I'm sick... I don't feel sick. Which is pretty damn awesome.

so i had a dream that i had an entire body transplant. it was a cute little trim body, but sean was creeped out cause it didn't look like me. even though i tried to convince him it was still me, he wasn't hearing it. finally i got annoyed and told him i would put back on my old body, but don't ever ask me to put on the new body to have sex.
I had an IUD implanted today. Holy shit that fucking hurt!
you're a total pain in the ass and I don't give a shit if you leave. maybe I'll leave first.

Got crappy news today. I have interstitial lung disease, either NSIP or UIP. NSIP is treatable with a course of steriods. UIP, on the other hand, kills 50% of patients in 3 years. I have to get more testing to find out which I have. Place your bets!

Polymyositis diagnosis about 2 weeks ago, rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis in March earlier this year. I thought getting a diagnosis would be good and get me on the road to feeling better. Turns out, diagnosing is just the beginning, and now I get to try out a variety of treatments that may/may not make be better and may/may not kill me.

fun.

One of the tenants I rented to a couple of months ago just died. He left his wife and their unborn baby. He was fairly young and looked in good health but died of heart attack.

So, so sad :(

Love each other, people. You never know when time's up.

Sometime in december last year I started to have weakness and pain in my hands. They were swollen and I couldn't wear my wedding ring anymore. After 4-6 weeks of the pain not subsiding I finally went to my doc. She sent me to get some tests and to see a specialist. 

After my 3rd visit and some trial and error, I've been diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. I cried the first time I heard that, and I'm still feeling sorry for myself. But I'm hopeful. At this point in time, I just hope the treatment works and I can get rid of the constant pain and swelling (which sometimes keeps me up at night.)

Things could be worse. Today I heard about a 27 year old woman with bone and breast cancer. So, giving myself a shot a week isn't bad. The idea of having deformed clawed hands that are fairly useless is pretty scary. You have no idea how much you take your hands for granted until it hurts to open a door, or you can't open a can of pop, or it hurts to hold a pen.

*sigh*

It's 1:30 in the morning, Thursday. I'm reading through some of my old posts, before Sean and I got married. Hell, before we were even officially dating. Life seems like it was more fun then... the economy and everything else has really been taking a toll on me (and everyone else). Reading those posts, though, reminds me of how much I love my husband and how much happier I am now that we're together.

Wow, I haven't been on here in like, FOREVER. Sean and I (and my mom and sis) are going to a YMCA water aerobics class. Damn what a difference it makes! I've been going 4 times a week since January... feels good!

So like I'm a total HOUSE MD junkie. My netflix list is full... 

I kinda go thru phases. First it was What Not To Wear, then it was Law and Order, then Lost, then it was Medium (actually, still is a fave but it's in between seasons), most recently Mythbusters.

Hey - Davey what was your take on Hulk? Certainly better than the first, but it was no IronMan

So, last night I made a confession to Sean that was really burdening me... I felt like such a BAD person. I and everyone always joke that I have no heart, because I don't have a whole lot of empathy for others.

But this... I didn't expect to be so shallow.

I told him that even though I was a little sad to have miscarried, I was mostly GLAD and relieved. I didn't want to be pregnant, I didn't want a baby, I didn't want the burden. But everyone else was so happy when they found out I was pregnant even though I was feeling ambivelant, and so sad when I lost it and I was feeling glad, that I felt I had to go along.

What pressure!

I figured I'd start getting baby-momma feelings once I saw the ultrasound/heard the heartbeat. But I was terrified that I would go months and still not want the baby.

It kind of makes me wonder... did I miscarry because I didn't want the baby, or did I not form an attachement to the baby because somehow I knew I would miscarry??

Sean was incredibly understanding. He'd been looking forward to the  baby so much that I was afraid he'd think I was the worst kind of person. But he said he wasn't surprised and totally understood. On some level, I already knew he knew I was relieved, but I didn't think he'd be ok with me being GLAD about it.

So I've gotten back on the pill, even though everyone thinks we should keep trying (we weren't really trying to begin with), but I'm really NOT ready to get pregnant... scary.

No more baby.

Word of caution: what you speak can become true. I had joked to Sean that it "wasn't too late" to change our minds... I also said I was tired of being pregnant and wanted it to be over.

BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU SPEAK.

/voodoo
So the dr called back... the test is inconclusive! GRRR... gonna have to try again in one week.
GAH! I went in to the dr's office today and they drew blood. I HAVE TO WAIT 2 DAYS for the results! As Tom Petty so eloquently put it, the waiting is the hardest part.

The baby might not happen after all...

I started bleeding yesterday. I have an appt to see the doc tomorrow.

Even if I miscarry, at least now I know we can get pregnant. We actually thought we would never have children, so that's a comfort. Plus, we'll be able to plan better next time, as this one took us by surprise.

But, I don't feel pregnant anymore. 

Don't be sad for me. I'm OK.

I just found out... I'm knocked up.

How weird.
We've got cool new tenants... now we have Geek Squad hook up! And they pay an outrageous amount of rent! Yay for single guys!
It has been 4 years and I love him more everyday.

Stolen ribald_faggot

*Use the 1st letter of your last name to answer each of the following... *they have to be real places, names, things...nothing made up! Try to use different answers if the person in front of you had the same 1st initial.

You CAN'T use your name for the boy/girl


1. Color...................................Lavender


2. 4 letter word.......................Lick


3. Vehicle: ................................Low rider


4. City / Neighborhood: ..........LA


5. Boy Name: ...........................Louie


6. Girl Name: .........................Linda


7. Occupation: .......................Livery driver


8. Something you wear:..........Leather


9. Food: .................................Liver


10. Found in a bathroom:..........Listerine


11. Reason for being late..........Cocaine


12. Something you shout........Come on!


13. Animal:...................................Capybara


14. Body part:..........................Coccyx


15. Word to describe you: ...........Crass
I love Tim Burton. I love Johnny Depp. But geez, Sweeney Todd was disappointing.

We've got our halloween pictures up, finally. Video coming soon.

http://hauntedgarage.us

Some people are so STUPID. Especially tenants:

Tenant Number 1: I'm not interested in Logan Square. I looked up the demographics and it's 70% hispanic. That's not a neighborhood I want to live in.
Me: *Shocked pause.* Ok, well we've got another unit in Andersonville.
Tenant: It shows up as the number one gay neighborhood in Chicago. I definitely am not interested in living there.

************************
Tenant Number 2: It's too far from the train.
Me: It's three blocks.
Tenant: Yeah, that's too far. I want something closer.

A compliment for our Haunted Garage:

Haunted Garage Masters,
 
You guys ROCK! The tall dudes were super freaky, your eerie version of the Pop Goes the Weasel song was in my head all night long, and the sobbing girl that turned in an instant with the come hither of her fingers was sheer genius. Strange and sublime weird is always the scariest......   
 
Haunted Garage 2007 was awesome - the highlight of my Halloween! A must do for me and my family every year now. Thank you!

I'M ALIIIIIVE!

So Sean and I had a totally kick ass haunt this year. Will be posting video of some of the screams we got. 

Crying kids, screaming teens, jumpy adults... it was heaven :)

I confess, I am an abuser of cell phones (dropped,kicked,flooded,etc). I use on every single day of my life, often for hours a day. (I know I'm going to die of brain cancer, but that's some time off yet.) I've always loved Nokias, but now I need a kick ass business phone... full web browser, full keyboard, fast processing. Oh yeah, and I gotta have enough memory for my million ring tones.

I've been looking at a bunch of phones, but I'm curious as to what you guys have and how you like them.

Reagardless of where we all may stand politically, I think we'd have to agree that this election period is going to be a very interesting and probably historic one. I'm curious, has anyone formed any opinions or hopes, or leaning any way? I'm still very undecided and in a wait-and-see mode. Normally, I would vote democrat because I think republicans are a bunch of judgemental, bible-thumping closed-minded bigots. But from what I preliminarily know about Guiliani, I am very tempted. From what I understand, he supports abortion rights, gay rights, and gun control. Plus, he did some great things with getting New York to be a more liveable place. And I tell you, his appearance on SNL when he was Mayor puts him in a totally different category from other candidates.

I'd really like to open up the forum for those who want to share... but everyone who participates, play nice.
Wow, the last 2 entries make me sound like a totally heartless bitch.
My mom is very upset about Anna Nicole Smith dying. I find it rather amusing.

It's been pretty freakin cold in Chicago (as elsewhere). So, yesterday we were watching the news and the news anchor grimly announces that we had the first death from the bitter cold over the weekend. A 27 year old woman died from exposure to the cold, and then under his breath, "and cocaine."

HAHAHA. We couldn't stop laughing.

Reminder: don't let little girls come into the office to use the bathroom.

Today, an 11 year old girl came in doing the pee pee dance and begging to use the bathroom. I told her to go ahead, she went, came out, said thank you and left. 

A little while later, I went in to use it.

There was a huge yellow puddle all over the floor.

It's 3:13 in the MORNING.

youtube is the devil.

I just love playing hardball :D

We were looking at buying a building on the south side, but we walked away after 3 weeks of negotiations cuz the seller was a totally unreasonable, demanding dick. I told him no way we were going to do the deal under his crazy terms.

2 weeks later, he sends me a fax, asking me to send him an offer, that he still wants to sell. I tell him, no thanks, stick it up your butt.

Then today, one week later, he calls that now he wants to do the deal on our terms. 

Ha ha ha. I love it.
One of the very few drawbacks of married life... you don't get to do whatever the hell you want.

When I was a kid, I learned pretty quickly that so called "friends" would often try to take advantage of you. So I closed off myself to most people. It might not be right, but it keeps me sane.

Once I grew become manager and trainer of my real estate office, I took my own personal time to help people pass their real estate exam, then train them and guide them. I spent my own, personal, unpaid hours helping them out.

One of them in particular needed more help than the others. There was a language barrier, so I spent an extraordinary effort helping him. I believed in him and his ability to succeed.

I never expected to feel betrayed again. In closing off my heart in social situations, I still left myself open in business. I felt that if I gave freely of my time, then I would receive something of equal value. I guess I've been too naive.

Sean and I host a haunted house in my parent's huge 3 car garage. This year we went all out on the exterior - building a graveyard with fence and columns, lots of corpses, creepy lighting and boarded up windows. Inside we'll have an egyptian tomb theme, complete with attacking mummies and a pharoah that pounces from his sarcophagus. Oh, and a nine foot grim reaper will stalk people outside. Hahaha! FUN. I will post pictures as soon as I figure out how to do it on LJ.

You know want to know something really weird? 

If I had not married Sean, I probably would have looked to get involved with a MTF trans lesbian. Top surgery yes, bottom surgery no. Best of both worlds.


(For the layman, this would be a woman who used to be a man, has woman parts up top and male parts below. Yes, I know it's weird so don't tell me that.)
Today is a dark, dark day.

(Click here to post your own answers for this meme.)

× I miss somebody right now. ✓ I don't watch much TV these days.  (Well, except for Medium. and Lost. and Malcolm in the Middle. and I'm really looking forward to Shark.) ✓ I own lots of books.
✓ I wear glasses or contact lenses. × I love to play video games. ✓ I've tried marijuana.  (I never did like it.)
✓ I've watched porn movies.  (Hahaha. You should see my porn collection.) × I have been the psycho-ex in a past relationship. ✓ I believe honesty is usually the best policy.
✓ I curse sometimes.  (What the f***!) × I have changed a lot mentally over the last year. × I carry my knife/razor everywhere with me.
* * * * *
× I have broken someone's bones. × I have a secret that I am ashamed to reveal. ✓ I hate the rain.  (Lies. I love love love the rain.)
× I'm paranoid at times. ✓ I would get plastic surgery if it were 100% safe, free of cost, and scar-free.  (Bigger boobies!) ✓ I need/want money right now.
✓ I love sushi. × I talk really, really fast. × I have fresh breath in the morning.
× I have long hair. ✓ I have lost money in Las Vegas.  (But I loved it!) ✓ I have at least one sibling.
✓ I was born in a country outside of the U.S.  (El Salvador) × I have worn fake hair/fingernails/eyelashes in the past. × I couldn't survive without Caller I.D.
× I like the way that I look. × I have lied to a good friend in the last 6 months. × I am usually pessimistic.
✓ I have a lot of mood swings.  (Although better since I got epilepsy meds.) × I think prostitution should be legalized. × I slept with a roommate.
× I have a hidden talent. × I'm always hyper no matter how much sugar I have. × I have a lot of friends.
× I have pecked someone of the same sex. × I enjoy talking on the phone. × I practically live in sweatpants or PJ pants.
✓ I love to shop and/or window shop.  (Only at Target though. Or World Market.) × I'm obsessed with my Xanga or Livejournal. × I'm completely embarrassed to be seen with my mother.
✓ I have a mobile phone. × I have passed out drunk in the past 6 months. ✓ I've rejected someone before.
✓ I currently like/love someone.  (My honey Sean.) × I have no idea what I want to do for the rest of my life. ✓ I want to have children in the future.  (Maybe.)
× I have changed a diaper before. × I've called the cops on a friend before. ✓ I'm not allergic to anything.
✓ I have a lot to learn.  (Like how to be nice to people I don't care about.) ✓ I am shy around the opposite sex. × I'm online 24/7, even as an away message.
× I have at least 5 away messages saved. ✓ I have tried alcohol or drugs before. × I have made a move on a friend's significant other or crush in the past.
✓ I own the "South Park" movie.  (Hahaha and all the TV episodes too.) × I have avoided assignments at work/school to be on Xanga or Livejournal. × I enjoy some country music.
× I would die for my best friends. ✓ I'm obsessive, and often a perfectionist.  (Only when it comes to work.) × I have used my sexuality to advance my career.
✓ I think Halloween is awesome because you get free candy.  (We put up a haunted garage. The crying screaming kids make it all worthwhile!) × I have dated a close friend's ex. ✓ I am happy at this moment.
× I'm obsessed with guys. ✓ Democrat.  (But they are often a bunch of winps.) × Republican.
× I don't even know what I am. × I am punk rockish. ✓ I go for older guys/girls, not younger.
✓ I study for tests most of the time.  (4.0 GPA, baby.) × I tie my shoelaces differently from anyone I've ever met. × I can work on a car.
× I love my job(s). × I am comfortable with who I am right now. × I have more than just my ears pierced.
× I walk barefoot wherever I can. × I have jumped off a bridge. × I love sea turtles.
× I spend ridiculous amounts of money on makeup. × I plan on achieving a major goal/dream. × I am proficient on a musical instrument.
× I hate office jobs. × I went to college out of state. × I am adopted.
✓ I am a pyro.   (Sort of. When our apartment building burned down, I thought it was a pretty light show.) × I have thrown up from crying too much. ✓ I have been intentionally hurt by people that I loved.
× I fall for the worst people. × I adore bright colours. ✓ I usually like covers better than originals.   (of 80's alternative.)
✓ I hate chain theme restaurants like Applebees and TGIFridays.  (Except Chili's) × I can pick up things with my toes. × I can't whistle.
✓ I have ridden/owned a horse. × I still have every journal I've ever written in. ✓ I talk in my sleep.  (and woken myself up.)
× I've often thought that I was born in the wrong century. ✓ I try to forget things by drowning them out with loads of distractions. × I wear a toe ring.
× I have a tattoo. × I can't stand at LEAST one person that I work with. ✓ I am a caffeine junkie.  (diet coke from breakfast to bedtime.)
× I am completely tree-huggy spiritual, and I'm not ashamed at all. × If I knew I would get away with it, I would commit at least one murder. × I will collect anything, and the more nonsensical, the better.
× I enjoy a nice glass of wine with dinner. × I'm an artist. × I am ambidextrous.
× I sleep with so many stuffed animals, I can hardly fit on my bed. × If it weren't for having to see other people naked, I'd live in a nudist colony. × I have terrible teeth.
× I hate my toes. ✓ I did this meme even though I wasn't tagged by the person who took it before me. × I have more friends on the internet than in real life.
× I have lived in either three different states or countries. × I am extremely flexible. × I love hugs more than kisses.
× I want to own my own business. × I smoke. × I spend way too much time on the computer than on anything else.
× Nobody has ever said I'm normal. × Sad movies, games, and the like can cause a trickle of tears every now and then. × I am proficient in the use of many types of firearms and combat weapons.
× I like the way women look in stylized men's suits. ✓ I don't like it when people are unpleased or seem unpleased with me. × I have been described as a dreamer or likely to have my head up in the clouds.
× I have played strip poker with someone else before. ✓ I have had emotional problems for which I have sought professional help. × I believe in ghosts and the paranormal.
× I can't stand being alone. × I have at least one obsession at any given time. × I weigh myself, pee/poo, and then weigh myself again.
× I consistently spend way too much money on obsessions-of-the-moment. × I'm a judgmental asshole. × I'm a HUGE drama-queen.
× I have travelled on more than one continent. × I sometimes wish my father would just disappear. × I need people to tell me I'm good at something in order to feel that I am.
× I am a Libertarian. ✓ I can speak more than one language.  (three) ✓ I can fall asleep even if the whole room is as noisy as it can be.
✓ I would rather read than watch TV. × I like reading fact more than fiction. ✓ I have pulled an all-nighter on an assignment I was given a month to do.  (three nights in a row)
× I have no piercings. × I have spent the night in a train station or other public place. × I have been so upset over my physical gender that I cried.
× I once spent Christmas completely alone because there was a miscommunication on which parent was supposed to have me that night. × There have been times when I have wondered "Why was I born?" and may/may not have cried over it. × I like most animals better than most people.
× I own a collection of retro games consoles. × The thought of physical exercise makes me shiver. × I have hit someone with a dead fish.
× I am compulsively honest. × I was born with a congenital birth defect that has never been repaired. × I have danced topless in front of dozens of complete strangers.
× I have gone from wishing I was a girl to revelling in being a boy to feeling like a girl again in the span of five minutes, and not cared a whit for my actual sex. × I am unashamedly bisexual, and have different motivations for my desires for different genders. × I sometimes won't sleep a whole night or eat a whole day because I forget to.
× I find it impossible to get to sleep without some kind of music on. × I dislike milk. × I obsessively wash my hands.
× I always carry something significant around with me. × Sometimes I'd rather wear a wig in day-to-day life than use my own hair. × I've pushed myself to become more self-aware and thereby more aware of others.
× Even though I live on my own I still cry sometimes because I miss my mother. × I hand wrote all the HTML tags in this document. ✓ I've liked something which a majority of people claimed was either bad or weird.
× I have been clinically dead for a brief period of time. ✓ Instead of feeling sympathy/empathy with people and their problems, I simply become annoyed.  (or laugh) × I participate/have participated in auto drag races and won.
✓ I do not 'get' most comedy acts.  (unless it's Eddie Izzard) × I don't think strippers are money-greedy or slutty for dancing. × I don't like to chew gum.
× I am obsessed with history/historical things and can't wait for someone to build a time machine so I can be the first to use it. × I can never remember for the life of me where I parked the car. ✓ I had the TEEN ANGST thing going for at least 2-3 years.  (4 years. Boy, was I angry.)
× I wish people would be more empathic and honest with each other. × I play Dungeons and Dragons weekly. ✓ I love to sing.  (But I can't hit any of the right notes and I never remember the lyrics.)
× I want to live in my mother's basement when I grow up. × I have a custom-built computer. × I want to create a certain someone's babies, even though there's a 0% possiblity of ever achieving it.
× I would be in a relationship with one of my pets if they were human. × I've gone skinny-dipping. × I've performed in three plays.
✓ I enjoy burritos. × I'm Irish and loving it. ✓ I have a thing for redheads.  (married one!)
× I am a twin! ✓ Most of the times, I'd rather do something intellectual instead of doing something generically 'fun'. ✓ Once I set out to finish something, I always stay at it until it is completed before I move on to something else.  (mostly.)
✓ I wish there were a way to erase past mistakes.  (I wish I'd never slept with anyone other than my husband. That is my biggest regret. The second biggest is) × I sleep more than 12 hours a day. × I wish I could be prouder of what I've accomplished, but it's never enough.
× I need more time to myself. × I wish I was more open-minded. × I hope that I go really prematurely grey.
× I download songs from the internet. × I've just reenacted chapter 58 of Death Note with my best friend. × I say random things to freak people out.
× I'm still a little mad about the ending of Death Note. × I love playing Truth or Dare. × I love listening to slow music, but I hate singing to it.
× Music helps me remember that I am not alone. × Playing my favorite sport makes me temporarily forget my problems. ✓ I think this survey is particularly long.
× I prefer my LJ friends to my real-life ones. × I can only hate someone that I love. × I've ordered an extra two shots of espresso to an Americano at Starbucks.

ever been at work and you want to kill everyone and then yourself?

yup. it's one of those days.

It is 9pm. I am still at work. I've been here from MORE THAN 12 HOURS.

Time to say bye-bye

I am a citizen of the United States of America.

I am a graduate of one of the best universities in the country.

I am my own boss and earn a good living.

I provide employment for many Americans.

I own my home and pay taxes.




I was an undocumented immigrant.

Think of your favorite underrated film, and on your favorite search engine do an image search. Find the best pic and then post it in your journal, but don't say what the name of the movie is! Once you post the picture, it's up to your friends to figure out what the movie is from the pic you posted!

Let me start out by saying I love horror movies. Love, love, love.

My sister and I went to see the hill have eyes yesterday. What a horrible piece of trash. It was excessively violent and gratuitously graphic. We actually walked out after watching the father getting burned alive and screaming in agony while his entire family watched horrified.

Disgusting.

Sean and I went to a friend's birthday party this weekend. And had the worst conversation ever with a poor sad sap.

Conversation part 1:
Guy: Yeah, I know these people through my dad.
Sean: Who's your dad?
Guy: R****
Sean: Oh, I know him! What a great guy! How's he doing?
Guy: He died of cancer.

Conversation part 2:
Guy: I used to live in California. My wife and I had a house out there, but a bunch of crack fiends move in next door so we had to sell.
Sean: I'm sorry to hear that.... Is your wife here?
Guy: We're divorced.

Way to party.

Holy shit. I never thought it possible, but I'm learning how to cook and I'm kicking ass!

This weekend, it's going to be an all-out cook fest to celebrate my brother-in-law's birthday. Everyone is coming over and playing WOW, like a bunch of geeks. I don't play cuz I'm not a big gaming dork.

I will however, be making pot stickers, jamaican beef patties, jerk chicken wings, strawberry crepes, chocolate chip-oatmeal cookies, and taco bar. I know it sounds like a great big nonsense conglameration, but this is all for 3 days of gaming.

I hope everything is good! I'm really excited.
